title: In a similar vein to low score, speedrunning...
content:
How about not killing any enemies? (I apologize if this has been discussed before, but I am a noob to this community).


A few weeks back I tried to see if I could beat Keen 4 on 'hard' without firing a single shot.

It was pretty challenging, but it was working okay. There was one level where you *have* to shoot a slug or something because the ceiling was too low to jump over it. It was the Pyramid of Gnosticene Ancients, I think.

But most of the levels needed to finish the game can be done without shooting anything.

Maybe you guys can figure out a way to get past that part I mentioned. I haven't tried it for any of the other Keen games--Obviously you have to fire once to finish Keen1, and my disk for the other two games in that trilogy is at my parent's house.
crymorenub

title: Re: In a similar vein to low score, speedrunning...
content: I tried this in my low score Keen 4 hard run. The short answer is that it's impossible, primarily because of Sand Yego and Pyramid of the Forbidden. It might be possible if you only play the required levels, but even then I think both of the pyramids would trip you up. Ruddy tight passages. Going through all of the levels requires something like 15 or 20 shots, sans maybe one or two.

title: Re: In a similar vein to low score, speedrunning...
content:
Yeah. I only did the required levels, and it was one of the pyramids where I ran into problems.

I'm sure you could finish on 'easy' without firing a shot though. But that isn't really the same.
crymorenub

title: Re: In a similar vein to low score, speedrunning...
content:
Yeah, those small passages are problematic. Not 100% sure, haven't tried it for a while, but I think it's impossible with easy as well, mainly because of some slug filling a passage.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: In a similar vein to low score, speedrunning...
content:
Keen 1 can be completed without firing a shot; getting past that last Vorticon is rather difficult, but you can usually get past him after a dozen or so tries.

Keen 2 requires at least 15 shots for me (Not all are needed for tantalus rays; simply touching the sparky thing saves a city)

Keen 3 requires seven shots to finnish, all in level 16.

Keen 4 I have found I can only do with 16 shots, though I may be able to use a few less.

Keen 5 I have not done, but initial levels look promising.

Keen 6, especially with the impossible bullet trick requires only 8 shots for me.

Keen dreams I required 18 shots, including Boobus Tuber; it was pure hell to finnish.

(All done on hard0


As you can tell, I am quite a pacifist. I have practised this often.

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]

Cute bunny!

title: Re: re
content:
I was screwing around some more with this over the weekend.


I found that Keen 4 is possible with just one shot.

In the Pyramid of the Shadows, when you first get to the elevator-jumping part over the tar there is a passage with a slug which you simply cannot get past without shooting.


But then again, I thought a lot of other parts in the pyramids were impossible too, but I eventually figured out how to get past them. Maybe somehow if I time the jump just right I can get past that slug.


I should note that I am skipping all the non-essential levels. I don't know how much things would change if you tried to do every level in the game.
crymorenub

title: Re: re
content:
I say vital levels only, if Keen were really being humanitarian. (Slugitarian?) I'm sure he'd not bother anybody that didn't need bothering.
[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]

Cute bunny!

title: Re: re
content:
Well, I did it!

Have you noticed how if you pogo jump, hit the ceiling and switch pogo off, keen will stay in the air for a few nanoseconds longer?

Well, if you get a running start and time it just right you can jump over this slug,



I have taken sort of a 'Quod Erat Demonstradum' approach to this. I saved the game before a difficult part, tried it a whole bunch of times and eventually got past it. So it is technically possible to finish the game without firing a shot.

But think actually getting through the game in one go like this would be just about impossible, as there is a lot of luck involved in a few of the parts.

But hell, I'll see if I can make a video of it all the same.

The bad news is, I've already forgotten how I did parts of the other pyramid!
crymorenub

title: Re: re
content:
